editing (scholarly) | Shillingsburg_1996

Scholarly editing […] is used to describe any sort of edition prepared by a person claiming to be a scholar. […] The term should be reserved for editorial efforts designed to make available for scholarly use works not ordinarily available or available only in corrupt or inadequate forms.
